Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Tickfaw -- 10 Mills Rededication - VC - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall one-half of the hereafter-received proceeds of the special ad valorem tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Village of Tickfaw (the "Village") currently levied in perpetuity under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, for the purpose of providing fire protection to the residents of the Village pursuant to an election held in the Village on October 17, 2009 (the "Tax") (an estimated $23,941.00 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the currently levied Tax for an entire year) be rededicated for the purpose of supporting the Village's general fund and the general operations of the Village?
